org.sonatype.aether.connector.async

Class HttpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sonatype.aether.connector.async.HttpServer

  • public class HttpServer
extends Object
    A helper for the tests to start an embedded HTTP server powered by Jetty. Create an instance of this class, use its mutators to configure the server and finally call start().
    Author:
    Benjamin Bentmann

      • setHttpPort

        public HttpServer setHttpPort(int httpPort)
        Sets the port to use for HTTP connections.
        Parameters:
        httpPort - The port to use, may be 0 to pick a random port (default), if negative the HTTP connector will be disabled.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • getHttpPort

        public int getHttpPort()
        Gets the port number of the server's HTTP connector.
        Returns:
        The port number of the server's HTTP connector.

      • getHttpUrl

        public String getHttpUrl()
        Gets the base URL to the server's HTTP connector, e.g. "http://localhost:8080".
        Returns:
        The base URL without trailing slash to the server's HTTP connector, never null.

      • setHttpsPort

        public HttpServer setHttpsPort(int httpsPort)
        Sets the port to use for HTTPS connections.
        Parameters:
        httpPort - The port to use, may be 0 to pick a random port, if negative the HTTPS connector will be disabled (default).
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • getHttpsPort

        public int getHttpsPort()
        Gets the port number of the server's HTTPS connector.
        Returns:
        The port number of the server's HTTPS connector.

      • getHttpsUrl

        public String getHttpsUrl()
        Gets the base URL to the server's HTTPS connector, e.g. "https://localhost:8080".
        Returns:
        The base URL without trailing slash to the server's HTTPS connector, never null.

      • setKeyStore

        public HttpServer setKeyStore(String path,
                     String password)
        Sets the keystore to use for the server certificate on the SSL connector.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the keystore to use for the server certificate, may be null.
        password - The password for the keystore, may be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • setTrustStore

        public HttpServer setTrustStore(String path,
                       String password)
        Sets the truststore to use for validating client credentials via the SSL connector.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the truststore to use for the trusted client certificates, may be null.
        password - The password for the truststore, may be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • setNeedClientAuth

        public HttpServer setNeedClientAuth(boolean needClientAuth)
        Enables/disables client-side certificate authentication.
        Parameters:
        needClientAuth - Whether the server should reject clients whose certificate can't be verified via the truststore.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • setProxyAuth

        public HttpServer setProxyAuth(String username,
                      String password)
        Sets the credentials to use for proxy authentication. If either username or password is null, no proxy authentication is required.
        Parameters:
        username - The username, may be null.
        password - The password, may be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • newProxyHandler

        protected org.mortbay.jetty.Handler newProxyHandler()

      • setRedirectToHttps

        public HttpServer setRedirectToHttps(boolean redirectToHttps)
        Enforces redirection from HTTP to HTTPS.
        Parameters:
        redirectToHttps - true to redirect any HTTP requests to HTTPS, false to handle HTTP normally.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • addUser

        public HttpServer addUser(String username,
                 String password,
                 String... roles)
        Registers a user.
        Parameters:
        username - The username, must not be null.
        password - The password, must not be null.
        roles - The roles of the user, may be empty or null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • addSecuredRealm

        public HttpServer addSecuredRealm(String pathSpec,
                         String... roles)
        Sets up a security realm.
        Parameters:
        pathSpec - The path to secure, e.g. "/files/*", must not be null.
        roles - The roles that have access to the realm, may be empty or null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • newSecurityHandler

        protected org.mortbay.jetty.Handler newSecurityHandler()

      • addResources

        public HttpServer addResources(String contextRoot,
                      String baseDirectory,
                      String... filteredExtensions)
        Adds resources to the server. Resources can be filtered upon serving using the tokens set via setFilterToken(String, String). The directory mounted into the server via this method will also be used to store files sent via PUT. Upon requests, the server will try to match the context roots in reverse alphabetical order, thereby giving longer path prefix matches precedence.
        Parameters:
        contextRoot - The context root to make the resources accessible at, must not be null.
        baseDirectory - The local base directory whose files should be served, must not be null.
        filteredExtensions - A list of extensions for files to filter, e.g. "xml, "properties", may be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • enableRecording

        public HttpServer enableRecording(String... patterns)
        Enables request recording for the specified URI patterns. Recorded requests can be retrieved via getRecordedRequests().
        Parameters:
        patterns - The regular expressions denoting URIs to monitor, e.g. "/context/.*", must not be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • getRecordedRequests

        public List<String> getRecordedRequests()
        Gets the sequence of requests that have been issued against context roots for which enableRecording(String...) was called. A request is encoded in the form <METHOD> <URI>, e.g. GET /context/some.jar.
        Returns:
        The sequence of requests since the server was started, can be empty but never null.

      • getRecordedHeaders

        public Map<String,String> getRecordedHeaders(String uri)
        Gets the headers sent in the most recent request to the specified path.
        Parameters:
        uri - the path
        Returns:
        the http request headers

      • setFilterToken

        public HttpServer setFilterToken(String token,
                        String value)
        Sets a token to replace during resource filtering. Upon server start, the following tokens will be defined automatically: @basedir@, @baseurl@, @baseuri@, @port.http@ and @port.https@.
        Parameters:
        token - The token to replace, e.g. @basedir@, must not be null.
        value - The replacement text of the token, may be null.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • newResourceHandler

        protected org.mortbay.jetty.Handler newResourceHandler()

      • setLatency

        public HttpServer setLatency(long millis)
        Sets the latency of the server.
        Parameters:
        millis - The latency in milliseconds, may be negative for infinite delay.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.

      • newSleepHandler

        protected org.mortbay.jetty.Handler newSleepHandler(long millis)

      • start

        public HttpServer start()
                 throws Exception
        Starts the server. Trying to start an already running server has no effect.
        Returns:
        This server, never null.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the server could not be started.

                          throws Exception
        Throws:

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the server. Stopping an already stopped server has no effect.
